title: Plans to ban fast food shops near schools
text:
Play video Click here to watch a video report by ITV News Anglia's Matthew Hudson A local council is chewing over the idea of banning new fast food outlets from setting up shop near schools to keep children healthy.
Milton Keynes Council is considering setting up an "exclusion zone" for new fast food outlets opening within a 400 metre radius of any local primary or secondary school.
The council's cabinet backed the plans to consult residents. It wants local people to tell them whether they think that's a good idea or not.
The idea is that the plans would help tackle childhood obesity. Credit: ITV News Anglia Experts say children who struggle with their weight are more likely to be overweight or obese when they grow up.
Figures show two thirds of adults are carrying too much weight. The ban - which would not affect existing outlets - will be discussed at the next full council meeting.
"We want to do all we can to encourage young people eat healthily. Research shows that where hot food takeaways are situated very close to school, young people will use them regularly.
